main event: On March 7, 1948, a yellow-orange oval object was observed in Smyrna, Tennessee, appearing to move very slowly and fading away over 45 minutes.
interesting points: The object was assessed to likely be the planet Venus based on its description and observed position., The sighting included a detailed checklist of characteristics such as color, shape, and distance from observers., There were four confirmed witnesses to the sighting, including military personnel., The weather conditions were clear, enhancing visibility at the time of the sighting., No photographs were captured during this incident, despite the use of a checklist for details.
witness description: Military personnel including a Major and several radio and tower operators
